findings.title: [Java SDK] Reliance on default encoding
findings.description: Multiple instances were identified where the `getByte()` standard Java API is used without specifying any encoding, causing the Java SDK to rely on the system default encoding which can differ across platforms and systems.

findings.title: [Java SDK] Outdated Vulnerable Dependencies
findings.description: The Java SDK uses outdated and vulnerable dependencies which can be exploited by attackers to craft malicious requests.

findings.title: [JavaScript SDK] Potential XSS in httpTransport()
findings.description: The `httpTransport()` method in the JavaScript SDK writes raw response messages from the endpoint when an error occurs, potentially leading to XSS if user-controlled data is reflected in the error message and not sanitized.

findings.title: [Go SDK] Outdated Vulnerable Dependencies
findings.description: Attackers identified vulnerable dependencies by observing the public GitHub repository of the SDK. They can then craft malicious requests that will be processed by SDK APIs to exploit these issues.

findings.title: [Go SDK] Downcasting of 64-bit integer
findings.description: Downcasting of a 64-bit integer to a lower precision value can result in potential overflow or underflow that is not handled by the Golang compiler, leading to an error or panic.

findings.title: [Go SDK] ReadHeaderTimeout not configured
findings.description: Attackers can exhaust server resources by opening multiple HTTP connections to the server, keeping the connections open, and slowly and continuously sending new HTTP header lines over the socket.

findings.title: [CSharp SDK] Outdated Vulnerable Dependencies
findings.description: Outdated dependencies introduced through Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Core and Apache.Avro can lead to Remote Code Execution, Insecure Defaults, and Denial of Service.
